newsitem.title: USA: U.S. OPTIONS FOCUS/Tech options are most active.
newsitem.headline: U.S. OPTIONS FOCUS/Tech options are most active.

text.p: Technology stock options were the flavor of the day on Thursday as most of the underlying shares continued to rebound from recent declines.
Technology stock options topped the actives list in both puts and calls on most exchanges, led by perennially active Micron Technology Inc.
The Micron November 27-1/2 put traded nearly 5,600 contracts on the CBOE. It traded another 2,450 contracts on the Pacific Stock Exchange.
Micron shares bucked the group trend, losing 3/4 to 26 on more than 4.5 million shares by afternoon.
"Technology stocks are still on the comeback trail," one trader said. "You're seeing a good deal of activity in the options, both calls and puts."
The technology-heavy Nasdaq composite index was up 10 points at 1,216, its session high.
On the CBOE, the busiest equity options included Hewlett-Packard Co, Cisco Systems Inc, International Business Machines Corp and Texas Instruments Inc.
At the American Stock Exchange, options on shares of Intel Corp, Motorola Inc and Novell Inc were among the most active.
Intel shares were up 2-5/16 at 109-1/16 in heavy trading. Motorola was unchanged at 45-7/8 after rising to 46.
Novell was unchanged at 9-3/8 but not before slipping to 8-3/4, a new low for the year.
The biggest trade, however, was in options on ADRs of Hanson Plc.
The Hanson December 12-1/2 call traded 8,234 contracts, most of which was done in two blocks, one of 6,000 contracts and one of 2,000. It was unchanged at 1/8 and had open interest of about 10,350.
Traders said an institutional investor was closing out a position. Hanson shares were down 1/8 at 6-3/8.
Traders said that overall, options activity was relatively sluggish amid hesitation ahead of the October U.S. employment report, due Friday before the market opens.
